title: Hugh of Provence abdicates the throne in favor of his son Lothair II who is acclaimed sole king of Italy.
text: Hugh of Provence abdicates the throne in favor of his son Lothair II who is acclaimed sole king of Italy.

title: Henry V is crowned Holy Roman Emperor.
text: Henry V is crowned Holy Roman Emperor.

title: Constantinople falls to the Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade, temporarily ending the Byzantine Empire.
text: Constantinople falls to the Crusaders of the Fourth Crusade, temporarily ending the Byzantine Empire.

title: Miyamoto Musashi defeats Sasaki Kojirō at Funajima island.
text: Miyamoto Musashi defeats Sasaki Kojirō at Funajima island.

title: Samuel Argall captures Native American princess Pocahontas in Passapatanzy, Virginia to ransom her for some English prisoners held by her father; she is brought to Henricus as hostage.
text: Samuel Argall captures Native American princess Pocahontas in Passapatanzy, Virginia to ransom her for some English prisoners held by her father; she is brought to Henricus as hostage.

title: George Frideric Handel's oratorio Messiah makes its world-premiere in Dublin, Ireland.
text: George Frideric Handel's oratorio Messiah makes its world-premiere in Dublin, Ireland.

title: American Revolutionary War: American forces are ambushed and defeated in the Battle of Bound Brook, New Jersey.
text: American Revolutionary War: American forces are ambushed and defeated in the Battle of Bound Brook, New Jersey.

title: The Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829 gives Roman Catholics in the United Kingdom the right to vote and to sit in Parliament.
text: The Roman Catholic Relief Act 1829 gives Roman Catholics in the United Kingdom the right to vote and to sit in Parliament.

title: Lajos Kossuth presents the Hungarian Declaration of Independence in a closed session of the National Assembly.
text: Lajos Kossuth presents the Hungarian Declaration of Independence in a closed session of the National Assembly.

title: American Civil War: Fort Sumter surrenders to Confederate forces.
text: American Civil War: Fort Sumter surrenders to Confederate forces.

title: American Civil War: Raleigh, North Carolina is occupied by Union Forces.
text: American Civil War: Raleigh, North Carolina is occupied by Union Forces.

title: The New York City Metropolitan Museum of Art is founded.
text: The New York City Metropolitan Museum of Art is founded.

title: The Colfax massacre, in which more than 60 African Americans are murdered, takes place.
text: The Colfax massacre, in which more than 60 African Americans are murdered, takes place.

title: The military of the Ottoman Empire reverses the Ottoman countercoup of 1909 to force the overthrow of Sultan Abdul Hamid II.
text: The military of the Ottoman Empire reverses the Ottoman countercoup of 1909 to force the overthrow of Sultan Abdul Hamid II.

title: The Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea is established.
text: The Provisional Government of the Republic of Korea is established.

title: Jallianwala Bagh massacre: British troops gun down at least 379 unarmed demonstrators in Amritsar, India; at least 1200 are wounded.
text: Jallianwala Bagh massacre: British troops gun down at least 379 unarmed demonstrators in Amritsar, India; at least 1200 are wounded.

title: Eugene V. Debs is imprisoned at the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary in Atlanta, Georgia, for speaking out against the draft during World War I.
text: Eugene V. Debs is imprisoned at the Atlanta Federal Penitentiary in Atlanta, Georgia, for speaking out against the draft during World War I.

title: A Pact of neutrality between the USSR and Japan is signed.
text: A Pact of neutrality between the USSR and Japan is signed.

title: World War II: The discovery of mass graves of Polish prisoners of war killed by Soviet forces in the Katyń Forest Massacre is announced, causing a diplomatic rift between the Polish government-in-exile in London from the Soviet Union, which denies responsibility.
text: World War II: The discovery of mass graves of Polish prisoners of war killed by Soviet forces in the Katyń Forest Massacre is announced, causing a diplomatic rift between the Polish government-in-exile in London from the Soviet Union, which denies responsibility.

title: The Jefferson Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C., on the 200th anniversary of President Thomas Jefferson's birth.
text: The Jefferson Memorial is dedicated in Washington, D.C., on the 200th anniversary of President Thomas Jefferson's birth.

title: Diplomatic relations between New Zealand and the Soviet Union are established.
text: Diplomatic relations between New Zealand and the Soviet Union are established.

title: World War II: German troops kill more than 1,000 political and military prisoners in Gardelegen, Germany.
text: World War II: German troops kill more than 1,000 political and military prisoners in Gardelegen, Germany.

title: World War II: Soviet and Bulgarian forces capture Vienna.
text: World War II: Soviet and Bulgarian forces capture Vienna.

title: In an ambush, 78 Jewish doctors, nurses and medical students from Hadassah Hospital, and a British soldier, are massacred by Arabs in Sheikh Jarrah. This event came to be known as the Hadassah medical convoy massacre.
text: In an ambush, 78 Jewish doctors, nurses and medical students from Hadassah Hospital, and a British soldier, are massacred by Arabs in Sheikh Jarrah. This event came to be known as the Hadassah medical convoy massacre.

title: CIA director Allen Dulles launches the mind-control program Project MKUltra.
text: CIA director Allen Dulles launches the mind-control program Project MKUltra.

title: American pianist Van Cliburn is awarded first prize at the inaugural International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow.
text: American pianist Van Cliburn is awarded first prize at the inaugural International Tchaikovsky Competition in Moscow.

title: The United States launches Transit 1-B, the world's first satellite navigation system.
text: The United States launches Transit 1-B, the world's first satellite navigation system.

title: At the Academy Awards, Sidney Poitier becomes the first African-American male to win the Best Actor award for the 1963 film Lilies of the Field.
text: At the Academy Awards, Sidney Poitier becomes the first African-American male to win the Best Actor award for the 1963 film Lilies of the Field.

title: An oxygen tank aboard the Apollo 13 Service Module explodes, putting the crew in great danger and causing major damage to the Apollo Command/Service Module (codenamed "Odyssey") while en route to the Moon.
text: An oxygen tank aboard the Apollo 13 Service Module explodes, putting the crew in great danger and causing major damage to the Apollo Command/Service Module (codenamed "Odyssey") while en route to the Moon.

title: The Universal Postal Union decides to recognize the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate Chinese representative, effectively expelling the Republic of China administering Taiwan.
text: The Universal Postal Union decides to recognize the People's Republic of China as the only legitimate Chinese representative, effectively expelling the Republic of China administering Taiwan.

title: Vietnam War: The Battle of An Lộc begins.
text: Vietnam War: The Battle of An Lộc begins.

title: Western Union (in cooperation with NASA and Hughes Aircraft) launches the United States' first commercial geosynchronous communications satellite, Westar 1.
text: Western Union (in cooperation with NASA and Hughes Aircraft) launches the United States' first commercial geosynchronous communications satellite, Westar 1.

title: An attack by the Phalangist resistance kills 26 militia members of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, marking the start of the 15-year Lebanese Civil War.
text: An attack by the Phalangist resistance kills 26 militia members of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, marking the start of the 15-year Lebanese Civil War.

title: The United States Treasury Department reintroduces the two-dollar bill as a Federal Reserve Note on Thomas Jefferson's 233rd birthday as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration.
text: The United States Treasury Department reintroduces the two-dollar bill as a Federal Reserve Note on Thomas Jefferson's 233rd birthday as part of the United States Bicentennial celebration.

title: Forty workers die in an explosion at the Lapua ammunition factory, the deadliest accidental disaster in modern history in Finland.
text: Forty workers die in an explosion at the Lapua ammunition factory, the deadliest accidental disaster in modern history in Finland.

title: Portugal and China sign an agreement in which Macau would be returned to China in 1999.
text: Portugal and China sign an agreement in which Macau would be returned to China in 1999.

title: Basements throughout the Chicago Loop are flooded, forcing the Chicago Board of Trade Building and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange to close.
text: Basements throughout the Chicago Loop are flooded, forcing the Chicago Board of Trade Building and the Chicago Mercantile Exchange to close.

title: Tiger Woods becomes the youngest golfer to win the Masters Tournament.
text: Tiger Woods becomes the youngest golfer to win the Masters Tournament.

title: The US drops the largest ever non-nuclear weapon on Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.
text: The US drops the largest ever non-nuclear weapon on Nangarhar Province, Afghanistan.
